quotes.text: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.
Consider how the wild flowers grow. They do not labor or spin. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.
For every house is built by someone, but God is the builder of everything.
The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands.
I planted the seed, Apollos watered it, but God has been making it grow.
Unless the LORD builds the house, the builders labor in vain.
He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the human heart; yet no one can fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
What do you have that you did not receive? And if you did receive it, why do you boast as though you did not?
For since the creation of the world God's invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made.
By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God's command, so that what is seen was not made out of what was visible.
The land is the source of all wealth... the farmer's labor is the only labor which produces more than the cost of the labor.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
We do not create. We discover. We do not invent. We uncover. The glory belongs to the One who hid it for us to find.
Look at the birds of the air; they do not sow or reap or store away in barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them.
He causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
